title: Trauma-Informed Self-Care
subtitle: Caring for yourself when everything feels hard
description: Standard self-care advice doesn't work for trauma survivors. This course teaches gentle, body-based practices for people whose nervous systems are sensitized. Learn to care for yourself without triggering overwhelm or shutdown.

whatYouLearn: Understand why trauma changes what self-care you need
Create genuine safety for your nervous system
Practice body-based care that doesn't overwhelm
Work within your window of tolerance while expanding it
Create sustainable practices for ongoing healing
requirements: Willingness to go slow and be gentle
Therapist or support person recommended for significant trauma

questions.question: Why doesn't standard self-care advice work for trauma survivors?
options: A sensitized nervous system can be overwhelmed by practices meant to be calming

questions.question: What is the 'window of tolerance'?
options: How much you can handle before exploding
The range of arousal where you can function and process experience

questions.question: What is 'resourcing' in trauma-informed care?
options: Building internal and external supports that help you regulate

questions.question: Why is safety emphasized before other work?
options: The nervous system can't heal or process while in survival mode

questions.question: How should body practices be approached with trauma?
options: Gently, with choice and control, at a pace that doesn't overwhelm

questions.question: What makes trauma-informed self-care sustainable?
options: Practices that feel safe, build capacity gradually, and adapt to your current state
Doing the same thing every day
